summary:
ABOUT US - Russia, officially known as the Russian Federation, is a country of grand scale and rich history. It is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than one-eighth of Earth’s inhabited land area, extending across eleven time zones, and sharing borders with fourteen countries. Russia’s vast territory spans Eastern Europe and Northern Asia, featuring a wide array of environments and landforms, from the deserts and semiarid steppes to dense forests and the Arctic tundra. The nation’s population is estimated at around 145,165,000 as of 2024, making it the world’s ninth-most populous country and the most populous in Europe. Moscow, the capital, is the largest city and a major political, economic, cultural, and scientific center in Russia and in Europe. Saint Petersburg, historically known as Leningrad, is the second-largest city and has had a significant impact on Russian history. Russia’s economy is diverse, with key sectors including energy, mining, manufacturing, and agriculture. The country is rich in natural resources and has one of the largest reserves of mineral and energy resources in the world, making it a significant player in the global energy market. Culturally, Russia has made a profound impact on the arts, especially in literature, ballet, classical music, and architecture. It is also known for its contributions to space exploration and science. Politically, Russia is a federal semi-presidential republic. As of 2024, the President is Vladimir Putin, and the Prime Minister is Mikhail Mishustin. The country has undergone significant changes since the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, transitioning from a globally-isolated, centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated one. Russia’s recent history has been marked by various international relations challenges and domestic policy issues, reflecting its complex position on the world stage
